abstract: Tata Steel topped an offer from Brazil’s Companhia Siderúrgica Nacional to win a heated auction for its European rival, the Corus Group.
snippet: Tata Steel topped an offer from Brazil’s Companhia Siderúrgica Nacional to win a heated auction for its European rival, the Corus Group.
lead_paragraph: BANGALORE, India, Wednesday, Jan. 31 — When the bidding was over, Tata Steel stepped away as the winner in a heated battle for its European rival, the Corus Group, topping an offer from Brazil’s Companhia Siderúrgica Nacional. Tata agreed to at least pay $12.2 billion for Corus.

headline.main: Tata Steel Buying Corus for $12 Billion
headline.print_headline: Tata Steel Buying Corus For $11 Billion
